title: BlackBerry, Lucid, Nike: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; BlackBerry reported an earnings beat; Results are due from Nike after the close
text:
* Electric-vehicle maker Lucid Group gained 1.6% premarket. The company, which went public in July, has picked up a few nods from Wall Street analysts in recent days.

* Trimble shares slipped 1.9% premarket. The technology company's stock received a ratings cut from Morgan Stanley, which set its price target at $74 a share. The stock closed Wednesday at $90.54.

* Blank-check company Amplitude Healthcare Acquisition, with a market cap of around $133 million, soared 53% premarket. Late Wednesday it said shareholders had approved its merger with biotech Jasper Therapeutics.

* Rite Aid fell 2.8% after the pharmacy chain updated its full-year guidance by dimming its adjusted earnings outlook for a steeper loss.

* Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants delivered an earnings beat, sending its shares up 4.2% premarket. The company authorized the repurchase of an additional $750 million in outstanding common stock, bringing the total remaining repurchase authorization to about $1 billion.

* H.B. Fuller shares added 2.7% premarket. The chemicals company reported better-than-expected revenue growth in the latest period.

* Steelcase slipped 5.2% premarket after the furniture company reported a revenue decline in the recent quarter from a year prior.

* KB Home inched up 1% premarket. The homebuilder reported higher profit in the fiscal third quarter as revenue climbed 47% on the back of continued high demand.

* Nike, Costco and Vail Resorts will report earnings after Thursday's close.

Chart of the Day

* Wagers on environmentally driven supply shortages are pushing up everything from natural gas to aluminum, increasing costs for consumers and businesses.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

BlackBerry, Lucid, Nike: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
